entries.meaning: comparative form of rash: more rash

description: Unknown origin. Said to be an alteration of rasure.

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland) A strip of bacon; a piece of bacon.
examples: Thick-cut, thin-cut or flavoured, sometimes there is nothing nicer than a rasher on toast or a crispy rasher as part of a full fry up.

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland) A strip, a piece (of something, such as ham, bacon, etc).

verbs.description: rasher (third-person singular simple present rashers, present participle rashering, simple past and past participle rashered)

examples: Most of the bacon sold is rashered or prepared as boiling joints in the retail shop, but recently there have been experiments in central arrangements for rashering bacon and its subsequent distribution pre-packed.
